page.title: 05A rural museum in Breamore 2
page.content: rural industries,all so authentically reproduced that one expects to hear the clang of the anvil in the blacksmith's shop or the satisfying splat of newly made butter being patted into shape in the dairy.Other rural crafts include a cobbler's shed, brewery and a wheelwright's shop.In one corner of the building is a full size replica of a 19th century farm labourer's cottage,with the table laid for tea ,kettle on the hob and geraniums in the window. A further collection of horse drawn vehicles and fire-fighting equipment can be seen in the Carriage Museum.The most eye-catching exhibit here must surely be{Red Rover}the last stage coach to run between London and Southampton.Many of the exhibits featured here were actually used on Breamore estate in the last century.
